title: Clarendon Italics $$$$$$$$$
content: Correct me if I am wrong. There is no Clarendon italics.
author: friends

comments.content: Canada Type has Clarendon Text, which has italics, H&FJ has Sentinel, which is a Clarendon.
[Superclarendon](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621104219/http:/www.typodermic.com/149.html) has a subtle, weight adjusted oblique.

As Akira & Chris mentioned, Sentinel does indeed have italics; they're one of the major reasons we developed the typeface. There's an article about this here, if you're interested:

[http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_history.php?historyItemID=2&product...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621104219/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_history.php?historyItemID=2&productLineID=100034 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_history.php?historyItemID=2&productLineID=100034")
